title: Wing Chun for Beginners - Baat Jaam Do
headline: Beginners can achieve mastery of Wing Chun Baat Jaam Do and see the importance of footwork with this free course.
description: Explore how Wing Chun Baat Jaam Do (butterfly knife) can be achieved by beginners. Learn about the footwork and basic steps necessary to start Baat Chun Jaam Do. You will also learn its various forms and how to use other parts of the body that are crucial for the effective practice of this martial art. Sign up today to begin this practical self-defence training course.
courseDescription:
This free online course provides you with the opportunity to understand how Wing Chun (or Ving Tsun) Baat Jaam Do (butterfly knife) skills can be achieved by beginners. It takes you through the basic steps necessary to start learning this martial arts move. You will learn the forms of Baat Jaam Do, as well as the other activities you need to practice before starting. Baat Jaam can be regarded as a self-defence activity and it is called Baat Jaam Do because of some of its specific attributes. The way you slide to the front will be the same way you slide to the back during the footwork for you to perfect your position. This course demonstrates the vital parts of the body that are crucial for effective practice.

Before you learn the Wing Chun Baat Jaam Do move, you need to know the steps because there is different footwork that makes it necessary to work on the basic moves. The hands need to be in good positions as this is important for mastering Wing Chun. This course will also help you acquire professional Chung Jam skills. You will learn about the positions of the upper and lower body while successfully making the move.

Upon successful completion of this course, you will be able to identify the roles of the left hand in Baat Jaam Do and how the right hand should be positioned. The material equips you with the requisite knowledge to take more courses in Wing Chun. Do you know that the butterfly knife should be placed in different positions with specific moves? We will guide you through the minimum time the Chung should be demonstrated and how to Chan Do, as well as the Jaam techniques that can be achieved. You will be able to demonstrate the position of the body when carrying out the Chung Do movement. You will also learn the simultaneous position of both hands during section three of Baat Jaam Do.
